data.title: The City of Derby
data.meta_description: The City of Derby | 963 followers on LinkedIn. A growing suburb south of Wichita, Derby (pop. 25,625) is a great place to start or further your career. | Located in the southeast Wichita metropolitan area, Derby is home to 26,000 residents and a wide range of retail, service and manufacturing businesses. Well-known for its outstanding school system and great recreational programs, Derby offers the best of small-town values combined with the resources of a growing community.
data.text:
The City of Derby is seeking a Benefits Manager. $25.75/hour, DOQ with excellent benefits What you will need: - Bachelor's degree. - Three years benefit coordination, experience coordinating a wellness program, and health plan administration. - Knowledge of principles and practices of wellness and insurance. - Familiarity with federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding employee benefits including FMLA, Workerâ€™s Compensation, and COBRA. Learn more and apply at www.derbyks.com/jobs. #workforderby

The National Recreation and Park Association designates July as Park and Recreation Month every year. The City of Derby regularly participates in honoring this designation. The goal of Park and Recreation Month is to promote the great opportunities and resources that local park and recreation agencies provide and to let the public know that July is a great time to get out and see all of the incredible things happening in their communities. Thank you to our Parks staff for all they do to keep Derby looking awesome! #parkandrecmonth #derbyproud

This week we celebrate Water Week. The goal of Water Week is to promote and recognize water and wastewater professionals and the vital role water plays in our daily lives. Thank you to our water and wastewater professionals who are on call 24/7 to ensure the safety and quality of our drinking water.

We're thrilled to see Derby, Kansas City Hall investing not only in their facility but also in their staff and community! The upgrades performed to their lobby created a safer and more productive work environment, while enhancing the overall visitor experience. We can't wait for everyone to enjoy the stunning new lobby as much as we do! ðŸ’š #TeamCCS #InteriorRemodel #DerbyPride

The City of Derby is seeking a part-time Communications Specialist who is an energetic self-starter with event planning and management experience along with marketing and communications experience. $22.20 per hour | Open until filled 29-hour work week, some nights and weekends required. Learn more and apply at https://lnkd.in/guZx_D6c. #workforderby

Learn more about Derby's new (and first-ever) Fire Training Chief, BJ Parsons. He has been with the department for nearly 20 years and has led training efforts leading up to this full-time opportunity.

The City of Derby has named Jonathan Marr as Derby Fire & Rescue's first Fire Marshal and BJ Parsons, Derby Fire Captain, as Derby's first Fire Training Chief. Congratulations to these two on their new positions. Learn more at Derbyks.com/news.

In July 2023, Derby City Clerk Lynn Ciarleglio became one of the first to receive the newly implemented Kansas Certified Municipal Clerk designation from City Clerks and Municipal Finance Officers Association through the WSU Public Policy & Management Center. In October 2023, Lynn earned her designation as a Certified Municipal Clerk from the International Institute of Municipal Clerks (IIMC). IIMC awards the designation of CMC to municipal clerks who complete demanding education requirements and have a record of significant contributions to their local government, community and state. Congratulations to Lynn on her accomplishments.
